column4: hey guys - I had a failed hard drive, so i was booting off my USB drive for a while. got my new HDD back today, and right after installing it, went to boot off of my flash drive again
check your boot options in your bios
checked, but I think it's worse - booted from another flash drive (4GB) without a problem, and plugged my original flash drive (16GB) in
I'm not sure I follow what your problem is. What exactly do you need it to do and what is it doing in reality?
I need it to appear in lsusb and, well, mount. instead, dmesg is showing http://pastebin.ca/1743257 , the flash drive's usb is either blinking steady but moderately fast, or steady and rather slow
ok, I'm not sure I'll be able to help you. I am wondering though, have you verified this drive works with another computer/OS?
I tried it in another laptop running vista - it recognizes that a usb drive was attached, but then gives the "USB device not recognized" error
sounds like there's either a problem with the drive itself or perhaps it hasn't been formatted. Do other usb drives work with ubuntu?
yeah, i'm booting off of another usb drive now. i know it's formatted/partitioned, since i was using it earlier today
You may be booted from one but can you plug in and mount another usb drive you know to be working(verified with another computer)?
if you have trouble with this drive in another OS that means the problem is most likely with that drive. Thus we want to be sure by checking if a different drive does work
those are the only two flash drives i can find at the moment
ok, from the sounds of it I'm inclined to think there's a problem with your flash drive, not with ubuntu.
yeah, i agree - have any tips for somehow recovering the data from the flash drive?
Since it doesn't appear to be showing up under /dev I don't know of anything you can do.
yeah, i'm kind of thinking the same =/
sorry to tell you that... I hate it when I have drives crap out. I've got to go afk for a bit, if you need further assistance someone else might be able to help you out
